speech.line: Gloucester’s eyes?

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: A servant that he bred, thrill’d with remorse,
Oppos’d against the act, bending his sword
To his great master, who, thereat enraged,
Flew on him, and amongst them fell’d him dead,
But not without that harmful stroke which since
Hath pluck’d him after.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: This shows you are above,
You justicers, that these our nether crimes
So speedily can venge! But, O poor Gloucester,
Lost he his other eye?

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: Both, both, my lord.
This letter, madam, craves a speedy answer;
’Tis from your sister.

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: One way I like this well,
But being widow, and my Gloucester with her,
May all the building in my fancy pluck
Upon my hateful life. Another way,
The news is not so tart.—I’ll read, and answer.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Where was his son when they did take his eyes?

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: Come with my lady hither.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: He is not here.

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: No, my good lord, I met him back again.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Knows he the wickedness?

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: Ay, my good lord; ’twas he inform’d against him,
And quit the house on purpose that their punishment
Might have the freer course.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Gloucester, I live
To thank thee for the love thou show’dst the King,
And to revenge thine eyes. Come hither, friend,
Tell me what more thou know’st.

scene.scenedescription: Kent meets the gentlemen he sent with news to Dover, from whom learns that troubles at home have forced the King of France to leave his army and return to his country, leaving Cordelia and a marshal in charge. The gentleman tells Kent of Cordelia’s grief as she heard how her sisters treated their father. Kent tells him that Lear refuses to see his daughter, so ashamed is he of how he treated her.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Why the King of France is so suddenly gone back, know you no reason?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Something he left imperfect in the state, which since his coming forth is thought of, which imports to the kingdom so much fear and danger that his personal return was most requir’d and necessary.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Who hath he left behind him general?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: The Marshal of France, Monsieur La Far.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Did your letters pierce the Queen to any demonstration of grief?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Ay, sir, she took them, read them in my presence,
And now and then an ample tear trill’d down
Her delicate cheek. It seem’d she was a queen
Over her passion, who, most rebel-like,
Sought to be king o’er her.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: O then it mov’d her.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Not to a rage, patience and sorrow strove
Who should express her goodliest. You have seen
Sunshine and rain at once; her smiles and tears
Were like a better way: those happy smilets
That play’d on her ripe lip seem’d not to know
What guests were in her eyes, which, parted thence,
As pearls from diamonds dropp’d. In brief,
Sorrow would be a rarity most beloved,
If all could so become it.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Made she no verbal question?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Faith, once or twice she heav’d the name of “father”
Pantingly forth, as if it press’d her heart;
Cried, “Sisters, sisters! Shame of ladies, sisters!
Kent! Father! Sisters! What, i’ th’ storm? I’ th’ night?
Let pity not be believ’d!” There she shook
The holy water from her heavenly eyes,
And, clamor-moistened, then away she started
To deal with grief alone.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: It is the stars,
The stars above us, govern our conditions,
Else one self mate and make could not beget
Such different issues. You spoke not with her since?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: No.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Was this before the King return’d?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: No, since.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Well, sir, the poor distressed Lear’s i’ th’ town,
Who sometime, in his better tune, remembers
What we are come about, and by no means
Will yield to see his daughter.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Why, good sir?

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: A sovereign shame so elbows him: his own unkindness,
That stripp’d her from his benediction, turn’d her
To foreign casualties, gave her dear rights
To his dog-hearted daughters—these things sting
His mind so venomously, that burning shame
Detains him from Cordelia.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Alack, poor gentleman!

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Of Albany’s and Cornwall’s powers you heard not?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: ’Tis so, they are afoot.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Well, sir, I’ll bring you to our master Lear,
And leave you to attend him. Some dear cause
Will in concealment wrap me up awhile;
When I am known aright, you shall not grieve
Lending me this acquaintance. I pray you go
Along with me.

scene.scenelocation: The French camp near Dover. A tent.
scene.scenedescription: Cordelia asks a doctor whether he can cure Lear’s madness; the doctor assures her that all Lear needs is proper rest. She sends out men to seek for him, just as she learns that the British forces are near at hand.
scene.stagedir: Enter, with Drum and Colors, Cordelia, Doctor, and Soldiers.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: Alack, ’tis he! Why, he was met even now
As mad as the vex’d sea, singing aloud,
Crown’d with rank fumitor and furrow-weeds,
With hardocks, hemlock, nettles, cuckoo-flow’rs,
Darnel, and all the idle weeds that grow
In our sustaining corn. A century send forth;
Search every acre in the high-grown field,
And bring him to our eye.
What can man’s wisdom
In the restoring his bereaved sense?
He that helps him take all my outward worth.

speech.speaker: DOCT.
speech.line: There is means, madam.
Our foster-nurse of nature is repose,
The which he lacks; that to provoke in him
Are many simples operative, whose power
Will close the eye of anguish.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: All blest secrets,
All you unpublish’d virtues of the earth,
Spring with my tears; be aidant and remediate
In the good man’s distress! Seek, seek for him,
Lest his ungovern’d rage dissolve the life
That wants the means to lead it.

speech.speaker: FR. MESS.
speech.line: News, madam!
The British pow’rs are marching hitherward.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: ’Tis known before; our preparation stands
In expectation of them. O dear father,
It is thy business that I go about;
Therefore great France
My mourning and importun’d tears hath pitied.
No blown ambition doth our arms incite,
But love, dear love, and our ag’d father’s right.
Soon may I hear and see him!

scene.scenedescription: Regan talks to Oswald about recent events. She is disturbed that Gloucester was not killed, and concerned about why Goneril would be writing to Edmund, with whom she is in love and whom she believes she has arranged to marry. She tells Oswald that whoever kills Gloucester will benefit from the deed. Oswald is excited at the prospect.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: But are my brother’s pow’rs set forth?

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: Ay, madam.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Himself in person there?

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: Madam, with much ado;
Your sister is the better soldier.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Lord Edmund spake not with your lord at home?

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: No, madam.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: What might import my sister’s letter to him?

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: I know not, lady.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Faith, he is posted hence on serious matter.
It was great ignorance, Gloucester’s eyes being out,
To let him live; where he arrives he moves
All hearts against us. Edmund, I think, is gone,
In pity of his misery, to dispatch
His nighted life; moreover to descry
The strength o’ th’ enemy.

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: I must needs after him, madam, with my letter.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Our troops set forth tomorrow, stay with us;
The ways are dangerous.

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: I may not, madam;
My lady charg’d my duty in this business.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Why should she write to Edmund? Might not you
Transport her purposes by word? Belike
Some things—I know not what. I’ll love thee much—
Let me unseal the letter.

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: Madam, I had rather—

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: I know your lady does not love her husband,
I am sure of that; and at her late being here
She gave strange eliads and most speaking looks
To noble Edmund. I know you are of her bosom.

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: I, madam?

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: I speak in understanding: y’ are; I know’t.
Therefore I do advise you take this note:
My lord is dead; Edmund and I have talk’d,
And more convenient is he for my hand
Than for your lady’s. You may gather more.
If you do find him, pray you give him this;
And when your mistress hears thus much from you,
I pray desire her call her wisdom to her.
So fare you well.
If you do chance to hear of that blind traitor,
Preferment falls on him that cuts him off.

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: Would I could meet him, madam! I should show
What party I do follow.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Fare thee well.

scene.scenepersonae: (Gloucester, Edgar, Lear, First Gentleman, Attendants, Oswald)
scene.scenedescription: Edgar leads Gloucester to a field, pretending it is the high cliff the old man asked for. Gloucester notices that Edgar is speaking better than he did, and that the ground does not feel steep at all, but Edgar convinces him he is wrong. Hoping to commit suicide, Gloucester jumps, thinking he has leapt off the cliff. Changing his voice, Edgar pretends to find him, and convinces him that the madman leading him was actually the devil – hoping thereby to stop his father from trying to kill himself again. Lear, madly dressed with wild flowers, comes in, talking madly; Gloucester recognizes his voice and tries to kiss the King’s hand. Finally, Lear admits that he recognizes the blind man. Gentlemen seeking Lear finally find him, but the King runs away. Edgar gets news of the coming battle from one of the gentlemen. Oswald enters, recognizing Gloucester, and attempts to kill him. Edgar kills him instead. As he lies dying, Oswald asks the ‘peasant’ to take the letters he is carrying to Edmund. Edgar opens them, and find a love letter from Goneril, plotting to kill Albany. Disgusted, he leads Glocuester off, hoping to find a friend to lodge him with until the battle is done.
scene.stagedir: Enter Gloucester and Edgar dressed like a peasant.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: When shall I come to th’ top of that same hill?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: You do climb up it now. Look how we labor.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Methinks the ground is even.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Horrible steep.
Hark, do you hear the sea?

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: No, truly.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Why then your other senses grow imperfect
By your eyes’ anguish.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: So may it be indeed.
Methinks thy voice is alter’d, and thou speak’st
In better phrase and matter than thou didst.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Y’ are much deceiv’d. In nothing am I chang’d
But in my garments.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Methinks y’ are better spoken.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Come on, sir, here’s the place; stand still. How fearful
And dizzy ’tis, to cast one’s eyes so low!
The crows and choughs that wing the midway air
Show scarce so gross as beetles. Half way down
Hangs one that gathers sampire, dreadful trade!
Methinks he seems no bigger than his head.
The fishermen that walk upon the beach
Appear like mice; and yond tall anchoring bark,
Diminish’d to her cock; her cock, a buoy
Almost too small for sight. The murmuring surge,
That on th’ unnumb’red idle pebble chafes,
Cannot be heard so high. I’ll look no more,
Lest my brain turn, and the deficient sight
Topple down headlong.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Set me where you stand.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Give me your hand. You are now within a foot
Of th’ extreme verge. For all beneath the moon
Would I not leap upright.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Let go my hand.
Here, friend, ’s another purse; in it a jewel
Well worth a poor man’s taking. Fairies and gods
Prosper it with thee! Go thou further off:
Bid me farewell, and let me hear thee going.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Now fare ye well, good sir.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: With all my heart.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Why I do trifle thus with his despair
Is done to cure it.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: O you mighty gods!
This world I do renounce, and in your sights
Shake patiently my great affliction off.
If I could bear it longer, and not fall
To quarrel with your great opposeless wills,
My snuff and loathed part of nature should
Burn itself out. If Edgar live, O bless him!
Now, fellow, fare thee well.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Gone, sir; farewell!
And yet I know not how conceit may rob
The treasury of life, when life itself
Yields to the theft. Had he been where he thought,
By this had thought been past. Alive or dead?—
Ho, you, sir! Friend! Hear you, sir! Speak!—
Thus might he pass indeed; yet he revives.—
What are you, sir?

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Away, and let me die.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Hadst thou been aught but goss’mer, feathers, air
(So many fathom down precipitating),
Thou’dst shiver’d like an egg: but thou dost breathe,
Hast heavy substance, bleed’st not, speak’st, art sound.
Ten masts at each make not the altitude
Which thou hast perpendicularly fell.
Thy life’s a miracle. Speak yet again.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: But have I fall’n, or no?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: From the dread summit of this chalky bourn.
Look up a-height, the shrill-gorg’d lark so far
Cannot be seen or heard. Do but look up.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Alack, I have no eyes.
Is wretchedness depriv’d that benefit,
To end itself by death? ’Twas yet some comfort,
When misery could beguile the tyrant’s rage,
And frustrate his proud will.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Give me your arm.
Up—so. How is’t? Feel you your legs? You stand.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Too well, too well.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: This is above all strangeness.
Upon the crown o’ th’ cliff, what thing was that
Which parted from you?

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: A poor unfortunate beggar.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: As I stood here below, methought his eyes
Were two full moons; he had a thousand noses,
Horns welk’d and waved like the enridged sea.
It was some fiend; therefore, thou happy father,
Think that the clearest gods, who make them honors
Of men’s impossibilities, have preserved thee.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: I do remember now. Henceforth I’ll bear
Affliction till it do cry out itself
“Enough, enough,” and die. That thing you speak of,
I took it for a man; often ’twould say,
“The fiend, the fiend!”—he led me to that place.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Bear free and patient thoughts.
speech.stagedir: Enter Lear mad, crowned with weeds and flowers.
speech.line: But who comes here?
The safer sense will ne’er accommodate
His master thus.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: No, they cannot touch me for coining, I am the King himself.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: O thou side—piercing sight!

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Nature’s above art in that respect. There’s your press-money. That fellow handles his bow like a crow-keeper; draw me a clothier’s yard. Look, look, a mouse! Peace, peace, this piece of toasted cheese will do’t. There’s my gauntlet, I’ll prove it on a giant. Bring up the brown bills. O, well flown, bird! I’ th’ clout, i’ th’ clout—hewgh! Give the word.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Sweet marjorum.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Pass.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: I know that voice.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Ha! Goneril with a white beard? They flatter’d me like a dog, and told me I had the white hairs in my beard ere the black ones were there. To say “ay” and “no” to every thing that I said! “Ay,” and “no” too, was no good divinity. When the rain came to wet me once, and the wind to make me chatter, when the thunder would not peace at my bidding, there I found ’em, there I smelt ’em out. Go to, they are not men o’ their words: they told me I was every thing. ’Tis a lie, I am not ague-proof.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: The trick of that voice I do well remember;
Is’t not the King?

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Ay, every inch a king!
When I do stare, see how the subject quakes.
I pardon that man’s life. What was thy cause?
Adultery?
Thou shalt not die. Die for adultery? No,
The wren goes to’t, and the small gilded fly
Does lecher in my sight.
Let copulation thrive; for Gloucester’s bastard son
Was kinder to his father than my daughters
Got ’tween the lawful sheets.
To’t, luxury, pell-mell, for I lack soldiers.
Behold yond simp’ring dame,
Whose face between her forks presages snow;
That minces virtue, and does shake the head
To hear of pleasure’s name—
The fitchew nor the soiled horse goes to’t
With a more riotous appetite.
Down from the waist they are Centaurs,
Though women all above;
But to the girdle do the gods inherit,
Beneath is all the fiends’: there’s hell, there’s darkness,
There is the sulphurous pit, burning, scalding,
Stench, consumption. Fie, fie, fie! Pah, pah!
Give me an ounce of civet; good apothecary,
Sweeten my imagination. There’s money for thee.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: O, let me kiss that hand!

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Let me wipe it first, it smells of mortality.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: O ruin’d piece of nature! This great world
Shall so wear out to nought. Dost thou know me?

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: I remember thine eyes well enough. Dost thou squiny at me? No, do thy worst, blind Cupid, I’ll not love. Read thou this challenge; mark but the penning of it.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Were all thy letters suns, I could not see.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: I would not take this from report; it is,
And my heart breaks at it.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Read.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: What, with the case of eyes?

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: O ho, are you there with me? No eyes in your head, nor no money in your purse? Your eyes are in a heavy case, your purse in a light, yet you see how this world goes.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: I see it feelingly.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: What, art mad? A man may see how this world goes with no eyes. Look with thine ears; see how yond justice rails upon yond simple thief. Hark in thine ear: change places, and handy-dandy, which is the justice, which is the thief? Thou hast seen a farmer’s dog bark at a beggar?

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Ay, sir.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: And the creature run from the cur? There thou mightst behold the great image of authority: a dog’s obey’d in office.
Thou rascal beadle, hold thy bloody hand!
Why dost thou lash that whore? Strip thy own back,
Thou hotly lusts to use her in that kind
For which thou whip’st her. The usurer hangs the cozener.
Thorough tatter’d clothes small vices do appear;
Robes and furr’d gowns hide all. Plate sin with gold,
And the strong lance of justice hurtless breaks;
Arm it in rags, a pigmy’s straw does pierce it.
None does offend, none, I say none, I’ll able ’em.
Take that of me, my friend, who have the power
To seal th’ accuser’s lips. Get thee glass eyes,
And like a scurvy politician, seem
To see the things thou dost not. Now, now, now, now.
Pull off my boots; harder, harder-so.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: O, matter and impertinency mix’d,
Reason in madness!

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: If thou wilt weep my fortunes, take my eyes.
I know thee well enough, thy name is Gloucester.
Thou must be patient; we came crying hither.
Thou know’st, the first time that we smell the air
We wawl and cry. I will preach to thee. Mark.

scene.stagedir: Lear takes off his crown of weeds and flowers.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Alack, alack the day!

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: When we are born, we cry that we are come
To this great stage of fools.—This’ a good block.
It were a delicate stratagem, to shoe
A troop of horse with felt. I’ll put’t in proof,
And when I have stol’n upon these son-in-laws,
Then kill, kill, kill, kill, kill, kill!

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: O, here he is: lay hand upon him.—Sir,
Your most dear daughter—

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: No rescue? What, a prisoner? I am even
The natural fool of fortune. Use me well,
You shall have ransom. Let me have surgeons,
I am cut to th’ brains.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: You shall have any thing.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: No seconds? All myself?
Why, this would make a man a man of salt
To use his eyes for garden water-pots,
Ay, and laying autumn’s dust.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Good sir—

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: I will die bravely, like a smug bridegroom. What?
I will be jovial. Come, come, I am a king,
Masters, know you that?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: You are a royal one, and we obey you.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Then there’s life in’t. Come, and you get it, you shall get it by running. Sa, sa, sa, sa.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: A sight most pitiful in the meanest wretch,
Past speaking of in a king! Thou hast one daughter
Who redeems nature from the general curse
Which twain have brought her to.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Hail, gentle sir.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Sir, speed you: what’s your will?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Do you hear aught, sir, of a battle toward?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Most sure and vulgar; every one hears that,
Which can distinguish sound.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: But by your favor,
How near’s the other army?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Near and on speedy foot; the main descry
Stands on the hourly thought.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: I thank you, sir, that’s all.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Though that the Queen on special cause is here,
Her army is mov’d on.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: I thank you, sir.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: You ever—gentle gods, take my breath from me,
Let not my worser spirit tempt me again
To die before you please!

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Well pray you, father.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Now, good sir, what are you?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: A most poor man, made tame to fortune’s blows,
Who, by the art of known and feeling sorrows,
Am pregnant to good pity. Give me your hand,
I’ll lead you to some biding.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Hearty thanks;
The bounty and the benison of heaven
To boot, and boot!

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: A proclaim’d prize! Most happy!
That eyeless head of thine was first fram’d flesh
To raise my fortunes. Thou old unhappy traitor,
Briefly thyself remember; the sword is out
That must destroy thee.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Now let thy friendly hand
Put strength enough to’t.

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: Wherefore, bold peasant,
Durst thou support a publish’d traitor? Hence,
Lest that th’ infection of his fortune take
Like hold on thee. Let go his arm.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Chill not let go, zir, without vurther cagion.

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: Let go, slave, or thou di’st!

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Good gentleman, go your gait, and let poor voke pass. And chud ha’ bin zwagger’d out of my life, ’twould not ha’ bin zo long as ’tis by a vortnight. Nay, come not near th’ old man; keep out, che vor’ ye, or I’ce try whither your costard or my ballow be the harder. Chill be plain with you.

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: Out, dunghill!

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Chill pick your teeth, zir. Come, no matter vor your foins.

speech.speaker: OSW.
speech.line: Slave, thou hast slain me. Villain, take my purse:
If ever thou wilt thrive, bury my body,
And give the letters which thou find’st about me
To Edmund Earl of Gloucester; seek him out
Upon the English party. O untimely death!
Death!

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: I know thee well; a serviceable villain,
As duteous to the vices of thy mistress
As badness would desire.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: What, is he dead?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Sit you down, father; rest you.
Let’s see these pockets; the letters that he speaks of
May be my friends. He’s dead; I am only sorry
He had no other deathsman. Let us see.
Leave, gentle wax, and, manners, blame us not:
To know our enemies’ minds, we rip their hearts,
Their papers is more lawful.

line.recite: “Let our reciprocal vows be rememb’red. You have many opportunities to cut him off; if your will want not, time and place will be fruitfully offer’d. There is nothing done, if he return the conqueror; then am I the prisoner, and his bed my jail; from the loath’d warmth whereof deliver me, and supply the place for your labor. Your (wife, so I would say) affectionate servant, Goneril.”

speech.line: O indistinguish’d space of woman’s will!:
A plot upon her virtuous husband’s life,
And the exchange my brother! Here, in the sands,
Thee I’ll rake up, the post unsanctified
Of murderous lechers; and in the mature time
With this ungracious paper strike the sight
Of the death-practic’d Duke. For him ’tis well
That of thy death and business I can tell.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: The King is mad; how stiff is my vild sense
That I stand up, and have ingenious feeling
Of my huge sorrows! Better I were distract,
So should my thoughts be sever’d from my griefs,
And woes by wrong imaginations lose
The knowledge of themselves.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Give me your hand;
Far off methinks I hear the beaten drum.
Come, father, I’ll bestow you with a friend.

scene.scenelocation: The French camp near Dover. A tent.
scene.scenepersonae: (Cordelia, Kent, Doctor, Lear, Servants, First Gentleman)
scene.scenedescription: Kent and Cordelia meet, and he asks permission to remain disguised for the time being. The doctor tells Cordelia that it is time to wake Lear up, which they do by playing music. Cordelia kisses him awake, and the doctor insists that she be the first to speak to him. Lear at first refuses to believe that it is she, terrified that he is still mad and merely dreaming of her. Gentle and humble now, he goes to walk with her outside. Kent learns what the rumors of the day are.
scene.stagedir: Enter Cordelia, Kent still dressed as Caius, and Doctor.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: O thou good Kent, how shall I live and work
To match thy goodness? My life will be too short,
And every measure fail me.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: To be acknowledg’d, madam, is o’erpaid.
All my reports go with the modest truth,
Nor more nor clipt, but so.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: Be better suited,
These weeds are memories of those worser hours;
I prithee put them off.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Pardon, dear madam,
Yet to be known shortens my made intent.
My boon I make it, that you know me not
Till time and I think meet.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: Then be’t so, my good lord.
How does the King?

speech.speaker: DOCT.
speech.line: Madam, sleeps still.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: O you kind gods!
Cure this great breach in his abused nature,
Th’ untun’d and jarring senses, O, wind up
Of this child-changed father!

speech.speaker: DOCT.
speech.line: So please your Majesty
That we may wake the King? He hath slept long.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: Be govern’d by your knowledge, and proceed
I’ th’ sway of your own will. Is he array’d?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Ay, madam; in the heaviness of sleep
We put fresh garments on him.

speech.speaker: DOCT.
speech.line: Be by, good madam, when we do awake him,
I doubt not of his temperance.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: Very well.

scene.stagedir: Enter Lear in a chair carried by Servants. First Gentleman in attendance. Soft music.

speech.speaker: DOCT.
speech.line: Please you draw near.—Louder the music there!

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: O my dear father, restoration hang
Thy medicine on my lips, and let this kiss
Repair those violent harms that my two sisters
Have in thy reverence made.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Kind and dear princess!

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: Had you not been their father, these white flakes
Did challenge pity of them. Was this a face
To be oppos’d against the warring winds?
To stand against the deep dread-bolted thunder?
In the most terrible and nimble stroke
Of quick cross lightning? To watch—poor perdu!—
With this thin helm? Mine enemy’s dog,
Though he had bit me, should have stood that night
Against my fire, and wast thou fain, poor father,
To hovel thee with swine and rogues forlorn
In short and musty straw? Alack, alack,
’Tis wonder that thy life and wits at once
Had not concluded all. He wakes, speak to him.

speech.speaker: DOCT.
speech.line: Madam, do you, ’tis fittest.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: How does my royal lord? How fares your Majesty?

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: You do me wrong to take me out o’ th’ grave:
Thou art a soul in bliss, but I am bound
Upon a wheel of fire, that mine own tears
Do scald like molten lead.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: Sir, do you know me?

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: You are a spirit, I know; when did you die?

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: Still, still, far wide!

speech.speaker: DOCT.
speech.line: He’s scarce awake, let him alone a while.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Where have I been? Where am I? Fair daylight?
I am mightily abus’d; I should ev’n die with pity
To see another thus. I know not what to say.
I will not swear these are my hands. Let’s see,
I feel this pin prick. Would I were assur’d
Of my condition!

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: O, look upon me, sir,
And hold your hand in benediction o’er me.
No, sir, you must not kneel.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Pray do not mock me.
I am a very foolish fond old man,
Fourscore and upward, not an hour more nor less;
And to deal plainly,
I fear I am not in my perfect mind.
Methinks I should know you, and know this man,
Yet I am doubtful: for I am mainly ignorant
What place this is, and all the skill I have
Remembers not these garments; nor I know not
Where I did lodge last night. Do not laugh at me,
For (as I am a man) I think this lady
To be my child Cordelia.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: And so I am; I am.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Be your tears wet? Yes, faith. I pray weep not.
If you have poison for me, I will drink it.
I know you do not love me, for your sisters
Have (as I do remember) done me wrong:
You have some cause, they have not.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: No cause, no cause.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Am I in France?

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: In your own kingdom, sir.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Do not abuse me.

speech.speaker: DOCT.
speech.line: Be comforted, good madam, the great rage,
You see, is kill’d in him, and yet it is danger
To make him even o’er the time he has lost.
Desire him to go in, trouble him no more
Till further settling.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: Will’t please your Highness walk?

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: You must bear with me.
Pray you now forget, and forgive; I am old and foolish.

scene.stagedir: Exeunt. Manent Kent and First Gentleman.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Holds it true, sir, that the Duke of Cornwall was so slain?

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Most certain, sir.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: Who is conductor of his people?

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: As ’tis said, the bastard son of Gloucester.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: They say Edgar, his banish’d son, is with the Earl of Kent in Germany.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Report is changeable. ’Tis time to look about, the powers of the kingdom approach apace.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT.
speech.line: The arbiterment is like to be bloody. Fare you well, sir.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: My point and period will be throughly wrought,
Or well or ill, as this day’s battle’s fought.

scene.scenepersonae: (Edmund, Regan, Gentlemen, Albany, Goneril, Soldiers, Edgar, Edmund)
scene.scenedescription: Edmund sends to find out whether Albany has changed his mind yet again about how to go about the battle. Jealous, Regan asks Edmund to assure her that he does not love Goneril, which he does. Albany insists that he is only fighting because the opposing army is French, not against Lear. Edmund and Albany arrange a later meeting to discuss combining their forces. Regan insists that Goneril not follow, to keep her away from Edmund. Edgar, disguised, enters and gives Albany the love letter he found, promising the Duke that a champion will vouch for its truth if he asks for one. Edmund urges Albany to go to the battle, which is about to begin. Alone, he reflects on how he has won the love of both sisters, and cannot decide between them, though they both have their uses. He is determined to make sure that Albany’s plan to be merciful to Cordelia and Lear fails.
scene.stagedir: Enter, with Drum and Colors, Edmund, Regan, Gentlemen, and Soldiers.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Know of the Duke if his last purpose hold,
Or whether since he is advis’d by aught
To change the course. He’s full of alteration
And self-reproving—bring his constant pleasure.

scene.stagedir: To Second Gentleman, who goes out.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Our sister’s man is certainly miscarried.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: ’Tis to be doubted, madam.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Now, sweet lord,
You know the goodness I intend upon you:
Tell me but truly, but then speak the truth,
Do you not love my sister?

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: In honor’d love.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: But have you never found my brother’s way
To the forfended place?

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: That thought abuses you.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: I am doubtful that you have been conjunct
And bosom’d with her—as far as we call hers.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: No, by mine honor, madam.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: I never shall endure her. Dear my lord,
Be not familiar with her.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Fear me not.
She and the Duke her husband!

scene.stagedir: Enter, with Drum and Colors, Albany, Goneril, Soldiers.

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: I had rather lose the battle than that sister
Should loosen him and me.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Our very loving sister, well bemet.
Sir, this I heard: the King is come to his daughter,
With others whom the rigor of our state
Forc’d to cry out. Where I could not be honest,
I never yet was valiant. For this business,
It touches us as France invades our land,
Not bolds the King, with others whom, I fear,
Most just and heavy causes make oppose.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Sir, you speak nobly.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Why is this reason’d?

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: Combine together ’gainst the enemy;
For these domestic and particular broils
Are not the question here.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Let’s then determine
With th’ ancient of war on our proceeding.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: I shall attend you presently at your tent.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Sister, You’ll go with us?

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: No.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: ’Tis most convenient, pray go with us.

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: O ho, I know the riddle.—I will go.

scene.stagedir: As they are going out, enter Edgar disguised. Albany remains.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: If e’er your Grace had speech with man so poor,
Hear me one word.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: I’ll overtake you.—Speak.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Before you fight the battle, ope this letter.
If you have victory, let the trumpet sound
For him that brought it. Wretched though I seem,
I can produce a champion that will prove
What is avouched there. If you miscarry,
Your business of the world hath so an end,
And machination ceases. Fortune love you!

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Stay till I have read the letter.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: I was forbid it.
When time shall serve, let but the herald cry,
And I’ll appear again.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Why, fare thee well, I will o’erlook thy paper.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: The enemy’s in view, draw up your powers.
Here is the guess of their true strength and forces,
By diligent discovery, but your haste
Is now urg’d on you.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: We will greet the time.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: To both these sisters have I sworn my love;
Each jealous of the other, as the stung
Are of the adder. Which of them shall I take?
Both? One? Or neither? Neither can be enjoy’d
If both remain alive: to take the widow
Exasperates, makes mad her sister Goneril,
And hardly shall I carry out my side,
Her husband being alive. Now then, we’ll use
His countenance for the battle, which being done,
Let her who would be rid of him devise
His speedy taking off. As for the mercy
Which he intends to Lear and to Cordelia,
The battle done, and they within our power,
Shall never see his pardon; for my state
Stands on me to defend, not to debate.

scene.scenelocation: The battlefield between the two camps.
scene.scenepersonae: (Powers of France, Cordelia, Lear, Edgar, Gloucester)
scene.scenedescription: Edgar sits Gloucester against a tree out of harm’s way to wait for the battle to be over. Soon after, he rushes back in: the French have lost, and they are all in danger. Edgar leads Gloucester away.
scene.stagedir: Alarum within. Enter, with Drum and Colors, the Powers of France over the stage, Cordelia with her Father in her hand, and exeunt.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Here, father, take the shadow of this tree
For your good host; pray that the right may thrive.
If ever I return to you again,
I’ll bring you comfort.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: Grace go with you, sir!

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Away, old man, give me thy hand, away!
King Lear hath lost, he and his daughter ta’en.
Give me thy hand; come on.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: No further, sir, a man may rot even here.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: What, in ill thoughts again? Men must endure
Their going hence even as their coming hither,
Ripeness is all. Come on.

speech.speaker: GLOU.
speech.line: And that’s true too.

scene.scenepersonae: (Edmund, Lear, Cordelia, Soldiers, Captains, Albany, Goneril, Regan, Herald, Edgar, Second Gentleman, Kent, Second Messenger)
scene.scenedescription: Edmund’s forces have captured Lear and Cordelia, and he sends them off to jail. Lear consoles his daughter with the fact that they will be together. Edmund bribes a captain to follow them and make an end of them. Albany enters, asking for the captives, and Edmund explains that he will produce them the next day. Albany puts him in his place, reminding him that he is not one of the rulers of the land. Regan immediately insists that he might as well be, as she intends to marry him. Goneril challenges her on this, and the quarrel escalates until Regan calls on Edmund to use his army to attack Albany’s. Albany arrests Edmund for treason, and challenges him. Regan is taken ill and has to leave, which is hardly surprising as Goneril has poisoned her. Edgar, masked, appears to take up the challenge against Edmund. They fight, and Edgar bests his half-brother. When Goneril tries to protest on a technicality, Albany proves to her that he has her love-letter, and advises her to stay quiet. Goneril, reminding Albany that she is Lear’s heir, not him, leaves. Edgar identifies himself, and tells of how Gloucester died when he told his father who he was. A messenger rushes in: Goneril has stabbed herself. Albany orders the bodies of the two sisters brought in, while Kent appears, looking for Lear. Suddenly remembering the existence of the old king, Albany asks Edmund where he sent them. Edmund, in his dying moments, tries to do some good and advises them to run, admitting that Lear and Cordelia are to be executed on his orders. But it is too late: Lear enters, holding the hanged Cordelia in his arms. He tries desperately to find some sign that Cordelia is still alive, but in vain. He recognizes Kent, but refuses to listen to his friend’s story of also being his servant ‘Caius’. Albany announces his intent to give supreme power back to Lear, but the old King dies. Albany asks Kent and Edgar to rule, but Kent intends to follow his master.
scene.stagedir: Enter in conquest, with Drum and Colors, Edmund, Lear and Cordelia as prisoners, Soldiers, Captain.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Some officers take them away. Good guard,
Until their greater pleasures first be known
That are to censure them.

speech.speaker: COR.
speech.line: We are not the first
Who with best meaning have incurr’d the worst.
For thee, oppressed king, I am cast down,
Myself could else out-frown false Fortune’s frown.
Shall we not see these daughters and these sisters?

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: No, no, no, no! Come let’s away to prison:
We two alone will sing like birds i’ th’ cage;
When thou dost ask me blessing, I’ll kneel down
And ask of thee forgiveness. So we’ll live,
And pray, and sing, and tell old tales, and laugh
At gilded butterflies, and hear poor rogues
Talk of court news; and we’ll talk with them too—
Who loses and who wins; who’s in, who’s out—
And take upon ’s the mystery of things
As if we were God’s spies; and we’ll wear out,
In a wall’d prison, packs and sects of great ones,
That ebb and flow by th’ moon.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Take them away.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Upon such sacrifices, my Cordelia,
The gods themselves throw incense. Have I caught thee?
He that parts us shall bring a brand from heaven,
And fire us hence like foxes. Wipe thine eyes;
The good-years shall devour them, flesh and fell,
Ere they shall make us weep! We’ll see ’em starv’d first.
Come.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Come hither, captain; hark.
Take thou this note
go follow them to prison.
One step I have advanc’d thee; if thou dost
As this instructs thee, thou dost make thy way
To noble fortunes. Know thou this, that men
Are as the time is: to be tender-minded
Does not become a sword. Thy great employment
Will not bear question; either say thou’lt do’t,
Or thrive by other means.

speech.speaker: 1. CAPT.
speech.line: I’ll do’t, my lord.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: About it, and write happy when th’ hast done.
Mark, I say instantly, and carry it so
As I have set it down.

speech.speaker: 1. CAPT.
speech.line: I cannot draw a cart, nor eat dried oats,
If it be man’s work, I’ll do’t.

scene.stagedir: Flourish. Enter Albany, Goneril, Regan, another Captain, Soldiers.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Sir, you have show’d today your valiant strain,
And fortune led you well. You have the captives
Who were the opposites of this day’s strife;
I do require them of you, so to use them
As we shall find their merits and our safety
May equally determine.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Sir, I thought it fit
To send the old and miserable King
To some retention and appointed guard,
Whose age had charms in it, whose title more,
To pluck the common bosom on his side,
And turn our impress’d lances in our eyes
Which do command them. With him I sent the Queen,
My reason all the same, and they are ready
Tomorrow, or at further space, t’ appear
Where you shall hold your session. At this time
We sweat and bleed: the friend hath lost his friend,
And the best quarrels, in the heat, are curs’d
By those that feel their sharpness.
The question of Cordelia and her father
Requires a fitter place.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Sir, by your patience,
I hold you but a subject of this war,
Not as a brother.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: That’s as we list to grace him.
Methinks our pleasure might have been demanded
Ere you had spoke so far. He led our powers,
Bore the commission of my place and person,
The which immediacy may well stand up,
And call itself your brother.

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: Not so hot.
In his own grace he doth exalt himself,
More than in your addition.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: In my rights,
By me invested, he compeers the best.

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: That were the most, if he should husband you.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Jesters do oft prove prophets.

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: Holla, holla!
That eye that told you so look’d but a-squint.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Lady, I am not well, else I should answer
From a full-flowing stomach. General,
Take thou my soldiers, prisoners, patrimony;
Dispose of them, of me; the walls is thine.
Witness the world, that I create thee here
My lord and master.

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: Mean you to enjoy him?

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: The let-alone lies not in your good will.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Nor in thine, lord.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Half-blooded fellow, yes.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Let the drum strike, and prove my title thine.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Stay yet, hear reason. Edmund, I arrest thee
On capital treason, and in thy attaint,
This gilded serpent
For your claim, fair sister,
I bar it in the interest of my wife;
’Tis she is sub-contracted to this lord,
And I, her husband, contradict your banes.
If you will marry, make your loves to me,
My lady is bespoke.

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: An enterlude!

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Thou art armed, Gloucester, let the trumpet sound.
If none appear to prove upon thy person
Thy heinous, manifest, and many treasons,
There is my pledge
I’ll make it on thy heart,
Ere I taste bread, thou art in nothing less
Than I have here proclaim’d thee.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: Sick, O, sick!

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: If not, I’ll ne’er trust medicine.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: There’s my exchange.
What in the world he is
That names me traitor, villain-like he lies.
Call by the trumpet; he that dares approach:
On him, on you—who not?—I will maintain
My truth and honor firmly.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: A herald, ho!

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: A herald, ho, a herald!

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Trust to thy single virtue, for thy soldiers,
All levied in my name, have in my name
Took their discharge.

speech.speaker: REG.
speech.line: My sickness grows upon me.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: She is not well, convey her to my tent.
Come hither, herald. Let the trumpet sound,
And read out this.

speech.speaker: 2. CAPT.
speech.line: Sound, trumpet!

line.recite: “If any man of quality or degree within the lists of the army will maintain upon Edmund, supposed Earl of Gloucester, that he is a manifold traitor, let him appear by the third sound of the trumpet. He is bold in his defense.”

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Sound!

speech.speaker: HER.
speech.line: Again!

speech.speaker: HER.
speech.line: Again!

scene.stagedir: Enter Edgar at the third sound, armed, a Trumpet before him.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Ask him his purposes, why he appears
Upon this call o’ th’ trumpet.

speech.speaker: HER.
speech.line: What are you?
Your name, your quality? And why you answer
This present summons?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Know, my name is lost,
By treason’s tooth bare-gnawn and canker-bit,
Yet am I noble as the adversary
I come to cope.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Which is that adversary?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: What’s he that speaks for Edmund Earl of Gloucester?

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Himself; what say’st thou to him?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Draw thy sword,
That if my speech offend a noble heart,
Thy arm may do thee justice; here is mine:
Behold, it is my privilege,
The privilege of mine honors,
My oath, and my profession. I protest,
Maugre thy strength, place, youth, and eminence,
Despite thy victor-sword and fire-new fortune,
Thy valor, and thy heart, thou art a traitor;
False to thy gods, thy brother, and thy father,
Conspirant ’gainst this high illustrious prince,
And from th’ extremest upward of thy head
To the descent and dust below thy foot,
A most toad-spotted traitor. Say thou “No,”
This sword, this arm, and my best spirits are bent
To prove upon thy heart, whereto I speak,
Thou liest.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: In wisdom I should ask thy name,
But since thy outside looks so fair and warlike,
And that thy tongue some say of breeding breathes,
What safe and nicely I might well delay
By rule of knighthood, I disdain and spurn.
Back do I toss these treasons to thy head,
With the hell-hated lie o’erwhelm thy heart,
Which for they yet glance by, and scarcely bruise,
This sword of mine shall give them instant way
Where they shall rest forever. Trumpets, speak!

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Save him, save him!

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: This is practice, Gloucester.
By th’ law of war thou wast not bound to answer
An unknown opposite. Thou art not vanquish’d,
But cozen’d and beguil’d.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Shut your mouth, dame,
Or with this paper shall I stopple it. Hold, sir.—
Thou worse than any name, read thine own evil.
No tearing, lady, I perceive you know it.

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: Say if I do, the laws are mine, not thine;
Who can arraign me for’t?

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Most monstrous! O!
Know’st thou this paper?

speech.speaker: GON.
speech.line: Ask me not what I know.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Go after her; she’s desperate, govern her.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: What you have charg’d me with, that have I done,
And more, much more, the time will bring it out.
’Tis past, and so am I. But what art thou
That hast this fortune on me? If thou’rt noble,
I do forgive thee.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Let’s exchange charity.
I am no less in blood than thou art, Edmund;
If more, the more th’ hast wrong’d me.
My name is Edgar, and thy father’s son.
The gods are just, and of our pleasant vices
Make instruments to plague us:
The dark and vicious place where thee he got
Cost him his eyes.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: th’ hast spoken right, ’tis true.
The wheel is come full circle, I am here.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Methought thy very gait did prophesy
A royal nobleness. I must embrace thee.
Let sorrow split my heart, if ever I
Did hate thee or thy father.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Worthy prince, I know’t.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Where have you hid yourself?
How have you known the miseries of your father?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: By nursing them, my lord. List a brief tale,
And when ’tis told, O that my heart would burst!
The bloody proclamation to escape,
That follow’d me so near (O, our lives’ sweetness!
That we the pain of death would hourly die
Rather than die at once!), taught me to shift
Into a madman’s rags, t’ assume a semblance
That very dogs disdain’d; and in this habit
Met I my father with his bleeding rings,
Their precious stones new lost; became his guide,
Led him, begg’d for him, sav’d him from despair;
Never (O fault!) reveal’d myself unto him,
Until some half hour past, when I was arm’d.
Not sure, though hoping, of this good success,
I ask’d his blessing, and from first to last
Told him our pilgrimage. But his flaw’d heart
(Alack, too weak the conflict to support!)
’Twixt two extremes of passion, joy and grief,
Burst smilingly.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: This speech of yours hath mov’d me,
And shall perchance do good: but speak you on,
You look as you had something more to say.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: If there be more, more woeful, hold it in,
For I am almost ready to dissolve,
Hearing of this.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: This would have seem’d a period
To such as love not sorrow, but another,
To amplify too much, would make much more,
And top extremity. Whilst I
Was big in clamor, came there in a man,
Who, having seen me in my worst estate,
Shunn’d my abhorr’d society, but then finding
Who ’twas that so endur’d, with his strong arms
He fastened on my neck and bellowed out
As he’d burst heaven, threw him on my father,
Told the most piteous tale of Lear and him
That ever ear received, which in recounting,
His grief grew puissant and the strings of life
Began to crack. Twice then the trumpets sounded,
And there I left him tranc’d.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: But who was this?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Kent, sir, the banish’d Kent, who in disguise
Followed his enemy king, and did him service
Improper for a slave.

scene.stagedir: Enter Second Gentleman with a bloody knife.

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: Help, help! O, help!

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: What kind of help?

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Speak, man.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: What means this bloody knife?

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: ’Tis hot, it smokes,
It came even from the heart of—O, she’s dead!

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Who dead? Speak, man.

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: Your lady, sir, your lady; and her sister
By her is poison’d; she confesses it.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: I was contracted to them both; all three
Now marry in an instant.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Here comes Kent.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Produce the bodies, be they alive or dead.
This judgment of the heavens, that makes us tremble,
Touches us not with pity.—O, is this he?
The time will not allow the compliment
Which very manners urges.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: I am come
To bid my king and master aye good night.
Is he not here?

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Great thing of us forgot!
Speak, Edmund, where’s the King? And where’s Cordelia?
speech.stagedir: Goneril and Regan’s bodies brought out.
speech.line: Seest thou this object, Kent?

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Alack, why thus?

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Yet Edmund was belov’d!
The one the other poison’d for my sake,
And after slew herself.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Even so. Cover their faces.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: I pant for life. Some good I mean to do,
Despite of mine own nature. Quickly send
(Be brief in it) to th’ castle, for my writ
Is on the life of Lear and on Cordelia.
Nay, send in time.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Run, run, O, run!

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: To who, my lord? Who has the office? Send
Thy token of reprieve.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: Well thought on. Take my sword. The captain—
Give it the captain.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Haste thee, for thy life.

speech.speaker: EDM.
speech.line: He hath commission from thy wife and me
To hang Cordelia in the prison, and
To lay the blame upon her own despair,
That she fordid herself.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: The gods defend her! Bear him hence awhile.

scene.stagedir: Enter Lear with Cordelia in his arms, Edgar and Second Gentleman following.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Howl, howl, howl! O, you are men of stones!
Had I your tongues and eyes, I’ld use them so
That heaven’s vault should crack. She’s gone forever!
I know when one is dead, and when one lives;
She’s dead as earth. Lend me a looking-glass,
If that her breath will mist or stain the stone,
Why then she lives.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Is this the promis’d end?

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Or image of that horror?

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Fall, and cease!

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: This feather stirs, she lives! If it be so,
It is a chance which does redeem all sorrows
That ever I have felt.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: O my good master!

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Prithee away.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: ’Tis noble Kent, your friend.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: A plague upon you, murderers, traitors all!
I might have sav’d her, now she’s gone forever!
Cordelia, Cordelia, stay a little. Ha!
What is’t thou say’st? Her voice was ever soft,
Gentle, and low, an excellent thing in woman.
I kill’d the slave that was a-hanging thee.

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: ’Tis true, my lords, he did.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Did I not, fellow?
I have seen the day, with my good biting falchion
I would have made them skip. I am old now,
And these same crosses spoil me. Who are you?
Mine eyes are not o’ th’ best; I’ll tell you straight.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: If Fortune brag of two she lov’d and hated,
One of them we behold.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: This is a dull sight. Are you not Kent?

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: The same:
Your servant Kent. Where is your servant Caius?

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: He’s a good fellow, I can tell you that;
He’ll strike, and quickly too. He’s dead and rotten.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: No, my good lord, I am the very man—

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: I’ll see that straight.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: That from your first of difference and decay,
Have follow’d your sad steps—

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: You are welcome hither.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Nor no man else. All’s cheerless, dark, and deadly.
Your eldest daughters have foredone themselves,
And desperately are dead.

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: Ay, so I think.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: He knows not what he says, and vain is it
That we present us to him.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Very bootless.

speech.speaker: 2. MESS.
speech.line: Edmund is dead, my lord.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: That’s but a trifle here.
You lords and noble friends, know our intent.
What comfort to this great decay may come
Shall be applied. For us, we will resign,
During the life of this old majesty,
To him our absolute power.
You, to your rights,
With boot, and such addition as your honors
Have more than merited. All friends shall taste
The wages of their virtue, and all foes
The cup of their deservings. O, see, see!

speech.speaker: LEAR.
speech.line: And my poor fool is hang’d! No, no, no life!
Why should a dog, a horse, a rat, have life,
And thou no breath at all? Thou’lt come no more,
Never, never, never, never, never.
Pray you undo this button. Thank you, sir.
Do you see this? Look on her! Look her lips,
Look there, look there!

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: He faints. My lord, my lord!

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Break, heart, I prithee break!

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: Look up, my lord.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: Vex not his ghost. O, let him pass, he hates him
That would upon the rack of this tough world
Stretch him out longer.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: He is gone indeed.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: The wonder is he hath endur’d so long,
He but usurp’d his life.

speech.speaker: ALB.
speech.line: Bear them from hence. Our present business
Is general woe.
Friends of my soul, you twain
Rule in this realm, and the gor’d state sustain.

speech.speaker: KENT.
speech.line: I have a journey, sir, shortly to go:
My master calls me, I must not say no.

speech.speaker: EDG.
speech.line: The weight of this sad time we must obey,
Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say:
The oldest hath borne most; we that are young
Shall never see so much, nor live so long.
